alert.note: Alert for Greene; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 2:13PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Greene and northern Sumter Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 213 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Panola to The University Of West Alabama. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Livingston, Eutaw, York, Forkland, Boligee, Gainesville, Epes, Emelle, New West Greene, Boyd, Allison, West Greene, The University Of West Alabama, Bluffport, Thornhill, Tishabee, Geiger, Warsaw, New Mount Hebron and Sumterville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
